description: From Middle English forthward, forthwardes, from Old English forþweard (“forward, tending forward, continual”), from Proto-Germanic *furþą (“forth-”), *warþaz (“turned”), equivalent to forth- +‎ -ward. Cognate with Old Saxon forþwerd, forþwerdes, forþwardes (“forthward”).

adverbs.description: forthward (comparative more forthward, superlative most forthward)
